reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Scaling up the Fight Against HIV/AIDS in Namibia

description.narrative: Based on the UNAIDS 2008 Report, Namibia has one the world’s highest HIV/AIDS infection rates with an adult HIV prevalence rate of 15.3 percent. Being the second most sparsely populated country in the world, providing comprehensive HIV/AIDS services to rural population requires a fully decentralized, community-based approach with strong policies and leadership from the central level. The program aims to reduce the impact of HIV/AIDS through an integrated approach to prevention, treatment, care and support, and mitigation of the impact on the affected populations. Prevention activities include strengthening of community based organizations, social mobilization, condom distribution, voluntary counselling and testing, and prevention of mother-to-child transmission (PMTCT). Treatment activities focus on the roll-out of anti-retroviral treatment (ART), care and support activities on the provision of home-based care and mitigation activities provide support to orphans and vulnerable children (OVC). The Rolling Continuation Channel (RCC) program is implemented by two Principal Recipients and includes Health Systems Strengthening (HSS) component to address cross-cutting health systems weaknesses, which have significant impact on HIV.

title.narrative: Number of medical male circumcisions performed according to national standards
GP Other-1: Number of people who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
M&E Other-2: Number of clients treated for Urethra Discharge Syndrome (UDS) in health facilities
Percentage of pregnant women who know their HIV status
M&E Other-7: Number and percent of HIV infected pregnant women who received ARVs to reduce the risk of mother to child transmission
Percentage of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
M&E Other-6: Number and percentage of children (0-14 years eligible for ART who receive ART (current)
M&E Other- 5: Number and percentage of adults (15+ years) eligible for ART who receive ART (current)
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
M&E Other-1: Number of men (15-49 years) circumcised in the 5 regions supported by the Global Fund
GP Other-2: Number of men and women who received an HIV test and know their results through door to door HCT strategy (including repeat testers)
TCS Other-1: % of district with health facilities dispensing ARVs for ART, which experienced a stock-out of at least 1 ARV in the last 12 months
M&E Other-4: Proportion of HIV positive TB patients given ART during TB treatment
M&E Other-3: Proportion of TB patients with an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
